basics.name: Jacob Hopkins
basics.label: Privacy & Security Researcher
basics.summary: A graduate researcher at TAMUCC investigating privacy and security issues involing credential verification.

awards.title: 1st Place Winner in Computer Science Oral Presentation
awards.summary: Pathways Student Research Symposium is a A&M system wide event for all students with that system to present their research. I won the oral portion of my division of the symposium.'

awards.title: Scholar Achievement in Graduate Education (SAGE) Fellowship Award
awards.summary: The SAGE Fellowship Award is awarded to students entering into terminal degree programs. It helps to fund up to three years of their studies.

work.name: Texas A&M University - Corpus Christi
work.summary: Working as a researcher at the Cybersecurity Research and Innovation Laboratory headed by Dr. Carlos Rubio Medrano. My primary research focus is data minimization issues associated with credential verification.

work.name: Office of Information Security, TAMUCC
work.summary: I was a student worker at the Office of Information Security in TAMUCC. While there, I worked in a team as a security analyst. Some of duties were the monitoring of the University's network, helping with risk assessments for the various colleges, and addressing vulnerabilities that were identified.
